JobFullDesc: Raytheon Missiles & Defense (RMD) Digital Technology is seeking an experienced leader to formulate digital strategy.  Reporting to the Director of Strategic Planning, this position will lead a diverse team to maintain business relationships with consumers of digital products, define plans that create strategic business value, and deliver integrated capability roadmaps that address major customer needs and shifts in the aerospace and defense industry. This role leads distinct teams in the disciplines of business relationship management, business architecture, information management and strategy development. This role orchestrates the application and integration of these disciplines to generate executive commitment to the strategy and provide actionable opportunity inputs to the portfolio and financial management process. Strategies developed by this role will span all areas of digital technology, including infrastructure, campus technology, applications, business systems and more. This role is accountable for challenging the status quo, and creating strategic alignment on key initiatives across Corporate, functions and partners by influencing senior leaders within RMD and engaging with senior leaders at Enterprise Services and other corporate functions. This position can be located near major RMD site and will require domestic travel about15-20% of the time.  Key Responsibilities: Develop vision, strategy, goals and objectives to align with business and customer outcomes. Create integrated capability roadmaps describing the necessary business and technology changes to achieve strategic objectives for multiple time horizons.Engage the Digital Technology Organizational Leadership to support execution of the strategy development process. Acquire and develop industry and supplier insights informing strategic opportunities and subsequent decision points.Structure strategic trade-offs and facilitate executive decisions with supporting data and analysis.Create strong business cases for evolving digital products by evaluating and balancing cost, benefit, risk and overall impact to priorities.Influences strategic alignment with other operating units of RTX and key external suppliers.Lead business relationship management between the digital technology organization and all functional organizations of RMD.Lead business architecture and information management disciplines in support of capability planning and to capture new value from data assets. Qualifications you must have: 12 years’ experience; preferably across multiple domain areas such as program management, engineering, digital technology, or supply chain.Minimum of 2 years’ experience leading technical strategy development for large businesses or at significant organizational scale.Prior experience with building, leading and developing teams.Project management experience with leading the development and execution of complex project plans.Experience improving the product development lifecycle (concept through sustainment) by identifying and leading value added enhancements to key value streams.Experience briefing at the executive/business leadership level.Bachelor’s degree; preferably in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) Or related Business Management Field.An active and in-scope Secret US security clearanceQualifications we value:Demonstrated success in strategic planning and ability to translate strategy to action and results. Previous success in managing large, complex projects simultaneously (with multiple funding sources) and developing creative and innovative solutions for large scale business challenges.Demonstrated ability to lead and integrate cross-functional teams to achieve outcomes through building strong relationships, team building, conflict resolution and collaborating in way that builds an environment of credibility, respect and trust.Demonstrated ability to articulate vision, negotiate and challenge respectfully and describe opportunities in a way that influences and aligns key decision makers on top priorities (utilizing strong verbal and written communications, presence and influence, and business and technical acumen).Strong understanding of multiple business disciplines and how they are integrated to drive execution (such as engineering design, manufacturing, test, quality, supply chain, manufacturing, finance and program management).Demonstrated ability to understand RTX business model and financial impacts to program performance.Certifications in any of the following areas will be helpful to the success of this leader:  Raytheon Six Sigma, Agile,certified business strategist or architect.Strong critical thinking skills, ability to exercise independent judgment and manage complexity and ambiguity.Working knowledge of DoD and manufacturing sector requirements and trends related to digital transformation.What We Offer:Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care. Clearance Information: This position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance. Non-US citizens may not be eligible to obtain a security clearance.
